section.name: description
section.description: The hfm CLI allows you to upload and download files as streams and to otherwise manipulate remote files as if they were local files.

command.name: cp
command.description: The hfm cp command allows you to copy files as streams.

command.name: ls
command.description: The hfm ls command allows you to list remote files.

section.name: name
section.description: hfm cp - copy files as streams

section.name: description
section.description: The "cp" command allows you to upload or download files as streams to the remote service.

section.name: examples
section.description: cat test.mov | pv -s 3846487146 | hfm cp -l '/home/user1/test.mov'\n\nhfm cp -r '/home/user1/test.txt' | pv -s 41115648 > hello.txt

option.name: -l
option.description: Allows you to copy a file from a local input stream (e.g. STDIN), to the server.

option.name: -r
option.description: Allows you to download a file from the server, to a local output stream (e.g. STDOUT).

section.name: description
section.description: The "ls" command allows you to list remote.
